posts.content: Raise your hand if you've rewatched this video more than 5 times 🙌

With cutting-edge science on his side, @chrishemsworth is back and ready to journey to the edge of his comfort zone—and learn how we can all live better. 

Season 2 of Limitless with Chris Hemsworth premieres August 15 on @DisneyPlus and @hulu. Season 1 is now streaming.
Bet you didn't think you'd be making eye contact with a juvenile African cheetah today 👁️

Dolphins playing with whales and their calves? @bertiegregory learned that when looking for sharks, Mother Nature doesn’t read the script and that’s no bad thing!🐬🐋 

Stream Sharks Up Close with Bertie Gregory, part of National Geographic's SharkFest event, on @disneyplus and @hulu.
How will you be branching out this summer?
Nature's got all the best surprises. What's the most mysterious thing you've ever stumbled upon while out in the wild? 🌳
Even the smallest moments are lessons for cheetah cubs. 💛
It's so easy to be overwhelmed by the beautiful vastness of space, especially when you see the first photos captured by the Vera C. Rubin Observatory in Chile: https://on.natgeo.com/brthobs
Do you ever just sit with your morning coffee and suddenly remember we're in space? ☕️ 🌏

Since 2006, National Geographic Explorer joelsartore has been traveling the globe to document as many species as humanly possible. Now, he has approached a number that once seemed unthinkable—17,000 species lovingly coaxed into posing for his camera. Usually, Sartore and his team select one species to highlight at each milestone, but with birds-of-paradise, he says, “It was just impossible for us to choose.” https://on.natgeo.com/BRTH070825

Want to know what a shark eats? Look at the shape of their teeth.

Sharks Up Close with @bertiegregory, part of Sharkfest, is now streaming on Disney+ and @hulu.

@bertiegregory went looking for great white sharks, but you won't believe the incredible marine life he encountered along the way. 🌊

Sharks Up Close with Bertie Gregory, part of SharkFest, is now streaming on Disney+ and @hulu.

These lion cubs' roars sound adorable—but that won’t last forever. When fully grown, a male lion's roar can travel up to five miles across sub-Saharan Africa. 🦁 🐾 

Queens is now streaming on Disney+ and @hulu.

We've all had less-than-flattering photos taken of us, and the blobfish is no exception. The now-famous image of Mr. Blobby, a blobfish that went viral years ago, shows a sad-looking creature that looked like it was melting—but that’s not how they actually appear in their natural habitat. See what blobfish really look like: https://on.natgeo.com/BRTHBF07042025
Caption this 👇
PSA: this post features red pandas ❤️
There's a pretty good chance you wouldn't hear this northern spotted owl flying towards you—their feathers are so light, they don't make any noise when they flap their wings 🤫
If trees could talk, we bet they’d just say “shhh” a lot 🌳
It'd have to be a giraffe—that's the way to get the best views! 🦒
The Pride flag is continuously evolving, with the latest intersex-inclusive design highlighting diverse identities within the community. https://on.natgeo.com/BRTH0628
Don't just touch grass, embody this piglet standing in it. 💛
If your date ever tells you they've got butterflies in their stomach, you should leave. That's not where butterflies belong.

The March of the Penguins is all about instinct.

Secrets Of The Penguins is now streaming on Disney+ and @hulu.

They just want to see you—and this barnacle goose—fly the nest 🥹

Narrated by @vancityreynolds, catch all-new Underdogs Sundays at 9/8c on @natgeotv. Now streaming on Disney+ and @hulu.

Did you know the Amazon rainforest is home to almost three million species? That includes around 40,000 plants, nearly 1,300 bird species, 3,000 fish, over 430 mammals, and 2.5 million insects—and we’re celebrating them all this World Rainforest Day!
Looking for a fun fact to celebrate World Giraffe Day? While their necks are far longer than ours, both humans and giraffes have seven vertebrae in their necks! 🦒
Can we get a global “out of office” so we can all just go on a collective nature walk? 🌍🚶‍♀️
Elio’s sense of wonder takes us to the stars 🌠 Join Zoe Saldaña and Nat Geo Explorer Dr. Bethany Ehlmann to talk all things space, and don’t miss @disney and @pixar's Elio, in theaters Friday.
Looking great, guys, very majestic, now let's do a silly one...
Tag your friend that looks like their pet. 🐶

Do you look like your dog? According to new research, it’s common for dogs and their owners to share striking similarities—not just in terms of appearance, but also temperament and personality. In fact, these similarities actually deepen over time. Learn more: https://on.natgeo.com/NGTH1606
This green sea turtle's fish friends gathered to celebrate World Sea Turtle Day—you should too! 🐢
We love an unbothered king 😌
You don't have to climb a tepui this Get Outdoors Day, but you should still go and get some fresh air—hug that tree, hike that trail, carpe that diem. 🚶

We knew those feathers looked familiar 🧐 

Stream these National Geographic shows now on Disney+, and don't miss @atsukocomedy's stand-up special Father, streaming now on @hulu.
Imagine being so iconic that your group name is a literal kaleidoscope ✨

What did one dolphin say to the other? 👀

No, seriously—we might be able to find out: https://on.natgeo.com/BRTHDCL0611
Rolex and the National Geographic Society are partnering on science-based expeditions to explore, study, and document change in the planet’s unique regions. Perpetual Planet

Presented by National Geographic Society in partnership with Rolex.

In December, a National Geographic Society expedition spotted an Antarctic gonate squid in the Southern Ocean. Finally visible alive, this rare species had previously only been seen in fishing nets or in the stomachs of fished marine animals. Read more: https://on.natgeo.com/BRTH061025
It's World Oceans Day, so give the ocean a wave. Or not, it's already got so many. 🌊
We're spending National Black Bear Day admiring them responsibly. From afar. However far you are from a black bear right now, that's probably the right distance to appreciate them from today.
What cats see in the dark is none of our business, thank you very much.
We can't get enough of the sounds a greater sage-grouse makes, this is our AMSR.

Is it the soulful eyes? The shaggy bangs? Maybe it’s a shared love for snacks. Science confirms what many pet parents have long suspected—we tend to look (and act) like our dogs: https://on.natgeo.com/4mL45qf

Share your "proof" in the comments 📸🐶

A female praying mantis has a unique definition of a "dinner date" 🍽️

It's World Parrot Day, and this macaw is your daily reminder to grab a little snack. You've earned it. 🦜

It's 30 seconds of barnacle goose chicks being, well, silly geese. What more could you ask for?
